turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Kesteven and Sleaford High School.
turn.1: What are the school's extracurricular activities?
turn.2: Theatre and field trips are also offered, especially in years 7 and 8, and since 1962 pupils have taken part in Duke of Edinburgh Award expeditions.
turn.3: Do the students participate in any other activities?
turn.4: Girl guiding has a long history at the school.
turn.5: What is the school's Girl guiding policy?
turn.6: In the early 1920s, the school had two companies of girl guides, but after their captain, Miss Gittings, left in 1925, the school groups were amalgamated with the town's company. The group was revived in 1955 as the 4th Sleaford Company led by Miss Outram.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: The company was active throughout the 1960s and 1970s, although Outram became divisional commander in 1969 and Misses Hudson and Broughton took over the school's guides, which were split into four patrols.
turn.10: As of 2015, the 4th Sleaford (High School) Guides schedule weekly meetings on Thursdays at 4:00 pm.
turn.11: What other programs are available at the school?
turn.12: A house system has existed since the school's early days, when the first houses were named Green and Yellow, after the school colours.
